channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [HBASE-12429] Add port to ClusterManager's actions.
item.description: Right now the ClusterManager doesn't have a port so there's no way to reliably run a chaos monkey on a cluster that has multiple regionservers running on a host.

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.

comments.comment: Patch that adds port to the interface. DistributedCluster doesn't take advantage of it yet since I don't have access to a cluster that uses ssh.

-1 overall. Here are the results of testing the latest attachment

-1 lineLengths. The patch introduces the following lines longer than 100:
+ clusterManager.kill(ServiceType.HBASE_REGIONSERVER, serverName.getHostname(), serverName.getPort());
+ clusterManager.stop(ServiceType.HBASE_REGIONSERVER, serverName.getHostname(), serverName.getPort());
+ if (!clusterManager.isRunning(ServiceType.HBASE_MASTER, initial.getMaster().getHostname(), initial.getMaster().getPort())) {
+ if(!clusterManager.isRunning(ServiceType.HBASE_MASTER, backup.getHostname(), backup.getPort())) {
+ if(!clusterManager.isRunning(ServiceType.HBASE_REGIONSERVER, sn.getHostname(), sn.getPort())) {
+ if(clusterManager.isRunning(ServiceType.HBASE_REGIONSERVER, sn.getHostname(), sn.getPort())) {
+ cluster.waitForRegionServerToStart(server.getHostname(), server.getPort(), PolicyBasedChaosMonkey.TIMEOUT);

+1 site. The mvn site goal succeeds with this patch.

+1 core tests. The patch passed unit tests in .
